text: Ryhall & Belmesthorpe railway station (originally Ryhall & Belmisthorpe) was a station in Belmesthorpe and about half a mile from Ryhall, both in Rutland. It was the only intermediate station on the Stamford and Essendine Railway, later Great Northern Railway, single track line between Stamford and Essendine. It was sited south of a level crossing at the west end of the village. The goods yard was to the north of the level crossing..British Railways Atlas.1947. p.17 ==References== Category:Railway stations in England Category:Rutland Category:1856 establishments in Europe Category:1959 disestablishments Category:1850s establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1950s disestablishments in the United Kingdom
title: Ryhall railway station
